{"step_by_step_thinking": "The mandibular molars, specifically the first and second, typically have two roots: a mesial root and a distal root. The mesial root often has two canals, while the distal root usually has one. However, the presence of accessory canals can vary. In the context of this question, it's important to note that the accessory canal is more commonly found in the mesial root of the mandibular molars.", "answer_choice": "B. Mesial root"}
